channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-16194] Should count in MSLAB chunk allocation into heap size change when adding duplicate cells
item.description: See more details about problem description and analysis in HBASE-16193
item.summary: Should count in MSLAB chunk allocation into heap size change when adding duplicate cells

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: Attaching a straight forward patch

158	  int getCellLength(Cell cell) {

Add @VisibleForTesting to the above method.

The test is in same package as the classes. So methods can be package private instead of public, right ?
Refine using of VisibleForTesting tag, following review comments.
Submit patch for HadoopQA to check

patch looks good to me. It's very interesting. MSLAB is the way to reduce gc, but under this situation it make it worse. 


  boolean succ = getCellSet().add(cell);

BTW 'succ' maybe renamed to be 'existed', wdyt?

Checking UT failures, TestReplicationSmallTests#testReplicationStatus is tracked by HBASE-16185, TestMasterReplication#testHFileCyclicReplication is tracked by HBASE-16201, and all irrelative to the patch here.

Actually in branch-1 code it's named as "notPresent" (see DefaultMemStore#internalAdd)... so IMHO the name succ is more explicitly indicating whether the add action succeeds and don't interfere with the detailed logic. Thoughts?
the action has succeeded actually when it return false. Never mind, it is trivial.

Yes, the CellSkipListSet#add method invokes Map#put, so the value will always be updated, and the returning boolean actually indicates whether there was an old value of the same key, not that straight forward for reading... Let's just leave it as is for now...
As mentioned above, UT looks ok, and have addressed all review comments by now. Will commit the change after getting enough +1

Thanks Ted and Heng for review. Have pushed the commit to master branch.

Attaching a patch for branch-1 and will commit if HadoopQA looks good.

FAILURE: Integrated in HBase-Trunk_matrix #1202 (See https://builds.apache.org/job/HBase-Trunk_matrix/1202/)
HBASE-16194 Should count in MSLAB chunk allocation into heap size change (liyu: rev 9cf012cd0086e054a66f54cb54771af2381fade0)

  • hbase-server/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/regionserver/AbstractMemStore.java
  • hbase-server/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/regionserver/HeapMemStoreLAB.java
  • hbase-server/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/regionserver/MemStoreCompactor.java
  • hbase-server/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/regionserver/MutableSegment.java
  • hbase-server/src/test/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/regionserver/TestDefaultMemStore.java
  • hbase-server/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/regionserver/Segment.java
Nice catch.. This is already committed? This should go into all applicable branches.

Thanks for the follow up Anoop Sam John.

Yes, this is already committed to master branch, and I planned to push into branch-1 after HadoopQA check (since the touched classes diverge between master and branch-1 code base) but not sure why it's still not triggered... Let me re-attach the branch-1 patch to try HadoopQA.
Re-attach the branch-1 patch to trigger HadoopQA
This should be applicable in 0.98+ all branches. Suggest it can go in all places. Ping RMs?

BTW
useMSLAB -> We say whether we used MSLAB for the coming cell. This name indicates saying whether to use MSLAB or not. Better name?

This should be applicable in 0.98+ all branches

Agree, and have prepared commits for all branch-1+ (waiting for HadoopQA), will prepare a patch for 0.98 later. Andrew Purtell Nick Dimiduk Sean Busbey and Mikhail Antonov, please let me know if you have any concern to push the patch here into relative branch, thanks.

useMSLAB... Better name?

Have added below comments for the parameter in internalAdd:

+   * @param toAdd the cell to add

+   * @param useMSLAB whether using MSLAB

+   * @return the heap size change in bytes

So maybe we should change the comment to "whether to use MSLAB for the cell"? Since the patch already gone into master branch, maybe an addendum here?
Why not just do long s = heapSizeChange(toAdd, notPresent || useMSLAB); in internalAdd instead of the extra logic in there now?
In case of duplicated Cell, it is not the heap size accounted but just the length of the cell (means key len+ value len+ tags len).. Heap size will have the heap overhead also. FYI

The doc comment is just fine. Ya the boolean indicates whether we are using MSLAB for this addition of cell. But the variable name kind of giving an meaning that it asks the method to use the MSLAB. That is why asking any better name.
I see, so maybe "mslabUsed" is better? Or any suggestion? Thanks.

Why not just do long s = heapSizeChange(toAdd, notPresent || useMSLAB);

Second Anoop, that we only need to count in the flattened size in chunk in case of duplicated Cell, using heap size will be over-counted.
Ya better I feel.. Can do as a small addendum for trunk
